headline: Big Oil Pours Billions into Biofuel Production to Meet Decarbonization Goals
summary: Oil and gas giants are investing heavily in biofuels like HVO and SAF as part of their decarbonization strategies, with a focus on greenfield developments, co-processing, and refinery conversions.

headline: Exxon Mobil's Lithium Leap: 100,000 Metric Tons To Fuel LG Chem's US Plant
summary: Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE:XOM) inked a non-binding MOU for a multiyear agreement with LG Chem, a chemical company with a diversified business portfolio. According to this, ExxonMobil will supply up to 100,000 metric tons of lithium carbonate from its planned U.S. project to LG Chem’s upcoming cathode plant in Tennessee, which is set to be the largest in the U.S. LG Chem’s Tennessee cathode plant, which began construction in December 2023, is projected to produce 60,000 tons annually. headline: Exxon Mobil signs non-binding lithium supply deal with LG Chem
summary: Exxon Mobil said on Wednesday it has signed a non-binding lithium supply deal with battery parts maker LG Chem, the oil giant's second agreement to supply the electric vehicle battery metal from its proposed Arkansas project.  Exxon last year announced plans to extract lithium from the Smackover Formation, an underground deposit of salty water known as brine that stretches from Florida through Arkansas and into Texas, using at least one type of direct lithium extraction (DLE) technology.  Exxon and other oil companies such as Occidental Petroleum and Equinor are increasingly investing in lithium projects, partly due to their belief that extracting the metal from brine involves similar processes as petroleum extraction.

raw.headline: Exxon Mobil signs non-binding lithium supply deal with LG Chem
raw.summary: Exxon Mobil said on Wednesday it has signed a non-binding lithium supply deal with battery parts maker LG Chem, the oil giant's second agreement to supply the electric vehicle battery metal from its proposed Arkansas project.  Exxon last year announced plans to extract lithium from the Smackover Formation, an underground deposit of salty water known as brine that stretches from Florida through Arkansas and into Texas, using at least one type of direct lithium extraction (DLE) technology.  Exxon and other oil companies such as Occidental Petroleum and Equinor are increasingly investing in lithium projects, partly due to their belief that extracting the metal from brine involves similar processes as petroleum extraction.

headline: LG Chem and ExxonMobil sign MOU for lithium offtake
summary: SPRING, Texas & SEOUL, South Korea, November 20, 2024--Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE: XOM) and LG Chem have signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding (MOU) for a multiyear offtake agreement for up to 100,000 metric tons of lithium carbonate. The lithium will be supplied from ExxonMobil’s planned project in the U.S. to LG Chem’s cathode plant in Tennessee, which LG Chem expects to be the largest of its kind in the U.S.

raw.headline: LG Chem and ExxonMobil sign MOU for lithium offtake

The lithium will be supplied from ExxonMobil’s planned project in the U.S. to LG Chem’s cathode plant in Tennessee, which LG Chem expects to be the largest of its kind in the U.S.
